materials.name: Flask
materials.description: Introduction to web programming with a little Flask web-server. Flask is a web micro-framework for Python, helping to handle HTTP requests on different uri-routes.
materials.img_alt: Poster: a Flask logo among colorful puzzle pieces.

materials.name: Git
materials.description: It is the most popular version control tool, helping developers collaborate. IT world uses it every day for coursework, projects, startups and hackathons.
materials.img_alt: Poster: logo of Git with the event info written like git commands.

materials.name: Firebase
materials.description: Would you like to learn how to design database architecture? If so, our next workshop is for you!😎 This time we will learn how to store data in Firebase - a platform that gives you functionality like analytics, databases, messaging and crash reporting so you can move quickly and focus on your users.
materials.img_alt: Poster: logo of Firebase as fire inside light lantern.

materials.name: Flutter
materials.description: Flutter is Google's mobile SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android📱 in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organisations around the world, and is free and open source.
materials.img_alt: Poster: logo of Firebase as fire inside light lantern.
